resources.string: Please select a function, or define a new one:

Name - Provide a name for your function. The built-in example is Voltage.

Formula - Provide the conversion function from voltage back into your unit. This is presented in the format y=x, where x is the received voltage and y is the converted unit. Many mathematical functions and operations are available; full documentation can be found at the official page. The variables y and x MUST be used.

Min and Max - These are the limits for the y-axis that the graph will display. If this is your first time running a certain function and you do not know how far the data will extend, you can experiment with these values by trying some, and using the Edit function from the Calibration screen to adjust them as needed.

Hit back button to return.
